name: Dijkstra's Shortest Path
latex: \text{Time: } O((V + E) \log V) \text{ with priority queue}
explanation: Dijkstra's algorithm finds shortest paths from a source to all other vertices in a weighted graph with non-negative edges. Uses a priority queue to always process the closest unvisited vertex. Essential for routing, GPS navigation, and network optimization. Guarantees optimal solution for non-negative weights. Time complexity depends on data structure: O(V²) with array, O((V+E)log V) with heap.

examples.problem: Find shortest path from A to D in weighted graph: A-B(3), A-C(1), B-D(2), C-D(4)
